oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Portrait of Helene (Nelly) Walsh, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A portrait of Helene (Nelly) Walsh, a prominent figure in Nashville art circles. Miss Walsh was a native of Nashville and lived here all her life except for periods of study in the East and in Paris. She had studied at the Art Students League in New York. Miss Walsh attended Nazareth Academy in Kentucky and was a graduate of the Ward Seminary in Nashville. She had lectured on art on several tours of the South. She was a communicant of St. Mary’s Cathedral and was a member of the Hermitage Association and the Centennial Club. She was the daughter of Edmond J. and Elizabeth Burke Walsh and sister to Mrs. Stanley Teachout and Edmond J. Walsh. Forms part of Mrs. Libbie (Walsh) Teachout Papers. 1 photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Walsh family; Teachout family
